direction.raw_text: .   1995. What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: West Vancouver Secondary School Class of '95.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? Whose initials?   Not the victim's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I called the school and had someone find them in a yearbook. Here's the original owner's name. But it could have been through a dozen pawn shops since then. He hands her a piece of paper.   Grace has a big smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor, can I take you back to Quantico with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I must remain where the hockey is good. Grace hands the paper to Reynaud. EXT. MEDICAL EXAMINER'S OFFICES - DAY Reynaud and Grace crossing through the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into radio, subtitled French) This is Special Unit Fourteen. I want a complete name search. Clark William. Surname is Edwards. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inspector Reynaud. Can we swing by the crime scene before we head back? Reynaud nods:     yes.    They get in his unmarked car. EXT. PARKING LOT CRIME SCENE - DAY Tape still up. The 24 Hour gym is closed for the day. Grace looking around. Laval studies a shrine of candles on the sidewalk. Grace sneaks up on him. She gets real close.       Laval watches the candles burn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inspector. Laval startles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mere a second, please. They cross to the victim's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Borrow your keys? Stand there like you're going to choke me. Grace pantomimes unlocking the door, drops the keys and reaches for her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keys drop straight down, how'd they end up over there under that car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were kicked. During the struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Kick them as hard as you can that way. Laval looks at her, kicks his keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not even halfway. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Grace crosses to the candles.     Laval follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had this case. This young hundred-pound woman was abducted from a parking lot. She kicked off a mirror, broke a window, dented her door. She struggled. This guy? Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything you are saying, you are saying one thing, do we trust Costa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good question.  Do we trust Costa? An unmarked car pulls up.     Reynaud drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in. INT. UNMARKED CAR - MOVING - DAY Grace and Laval get in, Reynaud guns it.       Grace belts in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found a current address here in Montreal. Reynaud leans on the HORN, aggressively maneuvering through traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys have an extra weapon? I didn't want to cross the border armed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The glove box. Grace opens it and finds a compact Glock.       She checks it, shoves it into her pocket. Reynaud swerves into the wrong lane. Stops cold in front of an apartment building. And gets out. Great driving. A mere two blocks away from the crime scene.       Laval gets out. Then Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY An upper floor. Grace, Reynaud and the MANAGER cross to a door. The Manager studies Costa's sketch of the attacker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never met him. We conducted our business by phone. They arrive at a door. Reynaud about to knock.   Grace stops him, listening at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I smell smoke. Back where I'm from anyone can kick a door if there's a fire. It's the 'citizen's arrest' of search warrants. Then: The SMOKE ALARM inside the apartment BUZZES O.S. Reynaud and Laval trade looks. Reynaud cocks a leg... The Manager unlocks the door a beat before Reynaud kicks it. Laval is no danger junkie, he's a little hesitant to enter. Grace gets down low, enters carefully, she knows what she's doing. INT. APARTMENT - DAY It's dark, drawn shades. A small studio. Reynaud and Grace move tactically with drawn guns. Grace enters the kitchen. Light smoke. Reynaud approaches the futon, a person-sized shape under the blankets. Reynaud whips aside the blanket. Just pillows. Grace checks under the sink. Reynaud checks the bathroom and shower. A coffee pot smokes, SIZZLING sludge on the bottom. Grace checks around the fridge, now satisfied no one lurks in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear. Grace turns off the burner. She crosses to a window, whips aside the curtains, and opens it. Coughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh.   Got a lung full. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Grace looks at a glass of orange juice, a half-eaten plate of food on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like this guy ran out in the middle of breakfast. Laval has entered, he stares out the window.      Grace looks out the window, REACTS. WHAT GRACE SEES The apartment window has a perfect view of the gym parking lot where the killing occurred. BACK TO SCENE Reynaud sees that and also REACTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should get out of here. Don't touch anything. They back out of there. INT. APARTMENT - DAY (AN HOUR LATER) Grace watches a CRIMINALIST bag a comb from the medicine cabinet. A couple hairs entwined in its teeth. In the kitchen another CRIMINALIST dusts for prints. Reynaud taking pictures with a large still camera. Laval KNOCKS on the walls. Laval moves a picture frame. A photograph falls out. Laval picks it up with surgical gloves. INSERT PHOTO: A dead ringer for Costa's sketch, carousing in a Thai bar. Laval shows Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resembles the man Costa sketched. (beat) Have you released him? You don't want your star witness steaming in a holding cell. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He went home twenty minutes ago. Agent Grace, where do you think Monsieur Edwards is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet Monsieur Edwards is in a deep grave with square corners like Messieurs Kohler and Ford. Which looks like all the victims. Maybe he's subconsciously killing himself. Grace finds a guitar case. Opens it. It's a mobile office; it has postage stamps. Postcards. Assorted stationery, different address labels. Neat, organized. Holiday cards. A CD titled: "Learn Flamenco Guitar." Hundreds of practice signatures. Forged documents. Victim's personal effects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll take that with us. (in French) Put a number and seal on that case. Reynaud SNAPS pictures of the guitar case. Grace is absorbing everything this little apartment can tell her. Bonding with the space. She smells a pillow. Thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever see a Hermit crab?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a crab that lives in the shells of dead sea snails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes. They have one big claw and curl up tight. Laval takes a long, sharpened screwdriver from his jacket. Begins prying off a door molding. Grace sits at the kitchen table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When they outgrow an old shell, they search for a new empty shell, crawl up to it and quickly switch. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They live in these beautiful shells because they have these soft ugly bodies. They couldn't survive without the shells. Neither can the guy we're after. Laval exposes several MINI DV and MICRO-CASSETTES hidden under the molding. INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - CLOSE ON A TV SCREEN - DAY Surprisingly clear video shot with a long night-vision lens. TODD FORD exits the 24 Hour Gym, gets in his car. WIDEN TO: The Director, Grace, Reynaud and Laval watch the video on the TV. Director Gillet turns it off. He is not in a good mood and that has Laval and Reynaud on edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could have had him this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Director, please. We are getting close. The hairs recovered from the apartment match the hairs recovered at the crime scene on Ford's body. We found hours of video like that of the victim. He has been following him, filming him for weeks. He tapped his phone and has recordings of Ford's calls. Even a CD with copies of Mr. Ford's E-mail folders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that much detail, you could become anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he hunts people and wears their lives as a kind of trophy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More like a kind of camouflage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his real name? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know what he looks like, we have his fingerprints, we know what he had for breakfast. But his name eludes us still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find it, Laval. Find him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Laval and Reynaud quickly exit.     Grace stays. INT. HALLWAY - DAY Director Gillet and Grace walk down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're working really hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone died last night because the asshole we're after isn't in custody. It's happened to me before and I'm sure it will happen again. It's a pretty miserable feeling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't felt it in a long time. (a beat) Dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I promised the boys I'd hang out tonight. I'm sorry. INT. BISTRO - NIGHT Grace, Reynaud and Laval have mussels and beer.      Laval watches the GUITARIST, a little melancholy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fair and I keep my promises. My informants trust me. I have eyes on the trains, on the buses. If they see him, they will tell me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe they will tell you. Why do you trust junkies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trust their fear of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say that in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I was a street cop in Philadelphia for three years before I joined the FBI. Grace speaks French.      Reynaud REACTS.    As does Laval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very nice.   You like to play games. Grace smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Ford worked as a cruise-ship musician. He would walk around and play his guitar on the decks at night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life is pretty cold sometimes. Man's just trying to spread a little music and gets murdered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He targeted Mr. Ford the night before he was supposed to get on a plane and meet a ship in Aruba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the new improved Mr. Ford was going to meet he ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think he has a plan B? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt it. He's been so meticulous and effective in the past, I bet he's never needed one. We can assume he has all sorts of fake IDs and passports. Disguises. But that's not enough for him, he has to be someone else. He gets off impersonating people. And he knows his current persona is compromised. Laval and Reynaud have stopped eating, are looking at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're always thinking. Save something for tomorrow. We have three boxes of evidence to go through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty cavalier attitude for a man who just got his ass chewed by his boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My papa dropped dead of a heart attack in front of a drill press at work. Not me. Grace understands.     Laval CLINKS her beer, Reynaud too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm dropping by Costa's, I still have a couple questions. (off Laval's look) I can't turn it off. EXT. ART GALLERY STREET - NIGHT A warm night, people are out. TEENS, COUPLES. Some OLD MEN argue politics. Grace approaches the gallery, keeping a low profile as she finds an angle to look inside. INT. ART GALLERY - GRACE'S POV - NIGHT (MOS) John Costa shares some Merlot with a statuesque ELEGANT WOMAN. She's laughing, flirting. Costa is making her laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ART GALLERY STREET - NIGHT Grace quickly crosses to the entrance. INT. ART GALLERY - GRACE'S POV - NIGHT An OLDER MAN joins them, the woman is his arm candy. Costa shakes his hand. The Older Man and the Elegant Woman exit. INT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT Grace enters. Costa sees her, REACTS, genuinely glad to see her. And that throws Grace a beat. She really likes his smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Costa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You caught me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet. Grace looks over the art.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toussant Jean Bernard. I met him in Haiti last year. Very troubled life. Outlived all his children. And he had ten. He lost his wife to cancer and went blind. Passed away last year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Overpriced folk art. Is it the work of a soul that has suffered? Sure. Are his explorations as an artist groundbreaking? No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ouch. And I was going to send you two and charge them to your Amex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't afford it. Costa is looking at her, looking through her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Daddy's Amex? I've sold quite a bit of art to poor little rich girls like you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Grace grows tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try the wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm partial to beer. And I don't have long. I came by to thank you for your help. And I apologize if you were detained. You did the right thing. Trying to save him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, thank you. Agent Vanderholt. (gives her a card) I'm having a show Friday. You should come by and meet some good people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows.   Where'd you learn CPR?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Medical school. Before I dropped out. I had a moment of clarity: in anatomy class I realized I'd rather draw bodies than cut them up. And when I realized I couldn't make art, I decided to sell it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's taken me all over the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About Monday again, did you see Mr. Ford fighting back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At first I thought I was interrupting something, you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought they were hugging. Then the gun came out when he saw me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess that's it. Thanks. Grace hands him a card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you remember any details or need anything. (off his look) Anything related to the case, please call me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Think about Friday. Please, Grace? Grace will; she exits. INT. HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Grace has turned the romantic little room into a cave of paperwork. Notes and photos cover the walls. Grace reads a phone bill taped to a lamp. Circles a number that keeps reappearing. INT. TASK FORCE ROOM - DAY (6:03 A.M.) The place is gearing up for a new day. Grace crosses to where Laval and Reynaud struggle awake with coffee and the morning paper. Grace takes a seat, grabs the sports section. A YOUNG DETECTIVE eats a grapefruit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning. Can you run this name? She got twenty hang-up calls from Edward's phone. The Young Detective takes a Post-It from Grace and crosses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to that beautiful thumbprint on the orange juice glass, you get an ID?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No hits. He's never been fingerprinted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. Any activity on Edward's accounts? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. I think he became Edwards a year ago. He was a software engineer. Did everything by the internet, he never met anyone face to face. Grace trades Reynaud for the front page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why a year ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edwards went on a river trip. Kohler was a guide. Grace REACTS.     Laval tosses her some papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are E-mails between Kohler and Edwards discussing the trip one year ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You connected Edwards and Kohler? Somebody was working all night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our suspect kills Kohler on the river, lives his life a year, kills Edwards and assumes his ID for a year. Then he stalks Ford, kills him but is interrupted by Costa. Think he's pissed at Costa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. The Young Detective returns with a report, hands it to Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agent Vanderholt, a report came back on the name. INT. UNMARKED CAR - MOVING - DAY Laval drives fast through a neat, modest neighborhood. Grace marveling at the police report. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She must have sounded like a total fruitcake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it. Grace watching Laval.      He looks pretty rough this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me go and be non-threatening. INT. ASHER HOUSE - DAY KNOCKING on the front door. The WOMAN from the ferry answers the door. Her name is REBECCA ASHER. She opens the door, smiles warmly at Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, please come in. Thank you for coming. INT. ASHER HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Classy decor. Grace sips Earl Grey.       Admires the impressive antiques.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad they finally sent someone, those hang-up calls have me terrified. They started right after I saw him. (a beat) I looked him directly in the eye. There was a moment of mutual recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think it's Martin calling and hanging up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It couldn't sound crazier, but who else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you ever asked to identify his body? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The body? Yes, they showed me some remains that had been hit by a pickup truck. The upper body was crushed. There was no face. I got physically ill. Mrs. Asher studies Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not Canadian, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I'm with the FBI. Grace shows her creds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was three. About two weeks ago. I began turning off my telephone when I go to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have some very nice things, Mrs. Asher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Some of them have been in my family for several generations. Please call me Rebecca. Grace looking at pictures on the wall of a good-looking, athletic kid. They stop at age fourteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that Martin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That's Reese. Martin's older brother. He drowned in a terrible accident. Grace notes a photo of a smiling young REESE receiving a long distance swimming trophy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry, Rebecca.    How did he drown?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The San Michel River. Martin fell out of their raft and Reese jumped in to save him. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a lot of snowmelt that year. Martin reached the bank. Reese didn't. It was their fourteenth birthday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their fourteenth birthday?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were twins. Identical twins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said Reese was older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By three minutes. They were very different boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To lose one son so young, then to lose the other two years later; to think you've lost him. That must have been devastating. Mrs. Asher lights a cigarette. Crosses to the window, so poised, so tragic. Grace studies her with a critical eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reese was very charismatic and outgoing. Martin was introverted. He never thrived like Reese. He was a very disturbed young man. Reese was Martin's world. Martin never recovered his equilibrium after we lost him. He changed. Martin began to intimidate me. He could be very menacing. He began imitating Reese at school and that lead to fights with other students. At sixteen he stole some jewelry that was very precious to me and ran away. A few days later the Thunder Bay police called and said my son had been killed changing a tire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police want you to sign this so they can exhume the body in Martin's grave and verify identity. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Mrs. Asher takes the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll sign it. I already know somebody else's son is in that casket. The PHONE RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. Mrs. Asher crosses to the kitchen and answers. Grace looking around, takes a look down a hallway. LAUGHTER O.S. as Mrs. Asher chats with a friend. INT. BATHROOM - DAY Grace pokes her head in, looks around.     Nothing of note. INT. MRS. ASHER'S BEDROOM - DAY The door opens and Grace peers in. Flowing silk, throw pillows, like a Sultan's tent. Interesting. INT. THE BOYS' ROOM - DAY Grace opens the door. Bingo. More LAUGHTER O.S. A bed, still made. Old toys. Sports equipment. An "R" on the headboard. On the other side; shadows on the wall where pictures used to hang. Indents in the carpet. Where a bed used to be. Grace's brow furrows.     Martin has been erased. INT. HALLWAY - DAY GROWLING. Grace turns. Sees a diminutive DOBERMAN SNARLING at her. The miniature hound guards a door. A door with several locks.    Grace takes a step toward it. The tiny dog bares its fangs. Grace reaches for a deadbolt. The little DOG GROWLING. One deadbolt is open. CLICK. Grace opens the other one. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Grace cracks the door.       Darkness, stairs leading to the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bathroom is there. Grace startles.        Mrs. Asher is right behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.     I was snooping. Grace closes the door.       Mrs. Asher escorts Grace away, past the boys' room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My friends call it the shrine.     It can be difficult to let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's killing people, isn't he? Grace nods:     yes.     Mrs. Asher assumed as much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't surprise you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   It doesn't. INT. UNMARKED CAR - MOVING - DAY Grace gets in. Laval shaving with an electrical razor. Laval pulls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That lady is definitely a queen without a country. I should have curtsied. (watches him shave) Hygiene on the road. Very efficient. The razor dies.        Leaving Laval half-shaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merde! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Grace trying not to laugh, hands him a form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She signed.   Start digging. EXT. GRAVEYARD - DAY A back hoe rips a bucket of earth from amidst the graves. A couple UNIFORMS watch. INT. AUTOPSY ROOM - DAY A cheap wood coffin sits on a gurney. The lid has been removed. Grace, Laval and Reynaud peer inside and REACT. Reynaud looks ill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm. Could be worse after getting run over by a pickup and twenty years in the ground. INT. AUTOPSY ROOM - DAY (10 MINUTES LATER) The body has been moved to the exam table. Covered with mold the corpse seems to be upholstered with baby blue velvet. The Medical Examiner checks the scale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bodies get mixed up all the time. Police found the wallet, called the mother and nothing was cross- checked. This was his head. Medical Examiner pulls a plastic bag from the coffin. Slices it open, revealing skull fragments and teeth. Passes them off to an ASSISTANT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that to Doctor Shivani and make sure someone signs for it. (to Grace) She'll rebuild his jaw line and check it against Martin Asher's dental X-rays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How soon, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a priority case, this afternoon maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE GYM - DAY Five XL-sized COPS pump iron before their shift. CAMERA FINDS GRACE. She's doing sit-ups on a decline bench, holding a 25- pound plate to her chest. She's a machine. Sweating. Intense. The cops can't help but to be impressed. Grace's CELL RINGS. She doesn't stop, does sit-ups faster. At the last second she answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone, panting) Vanderholt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (filtered) Am I interrupting something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The X-rays don't match.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find the real Martin Asher. He's your killer. (a beat) You better get his mother someplace safe. EXT. POSH HOTEL LOBBY - NIGHT An UNMARKED parked with Laval and Grace inside.     They watch: INT. POSH HOTEL LOBBY - GRACE'S POV - NIGHT MRS. ASHER checking in. INT. UNMARKED CAR - NIGHT GRACE How'd she finagle a room there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a very slick woman. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't have one picture of Martin. Not one. Even cut him out of the old yearbooks. And she had a basement door like a vault. She's hiding something. In the basement of her house. What is it, ten minutes away from here? Her house. A beat.   Laval looks at Grace, decides he can trust her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she's under our protection and something happens to her house, her belongings, the department could be liable. There could be a lawsuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. We should make sure her front door is locked. Laval makes a U-turn. INT. ASHER HOUSE - NIGHT The front door opens. Revealing Grace, and Laval as he pockets a lockpick gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll stay outside. Kill him if he's in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'll get 'em. Grace enters with a flashlight and a pistol. She cautiously clears each room until she is sure she is alone. Grace crosses to the hallway. The little dog is there. GROWLING. Grace tosses it a hamburger patty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's be friends. The dog happily attacks its treat as Grace opens the deadbolts on the door the little dog was guarding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BASEMENT - NIGHT Grace descends CREAKING STOPS. Shining her light around. Old boxes. Furniture. Forgotten things. Dust. Grace is looking for something and she's not sure what. She spots a door chain. She moves some boxes. Finds a leather razor strop hanging next to a small door. Grace's hand undoes the chain. Lifts the latch and opens the door as rusted HINGES SQUEAL. INT. MARTIN'S CELL - NIGHT Grace moves aside cobwebs with her big flashlight. The room is tiny. Exposed joists overhead. Grace sits on the cold concrete. A sleeping bag rolled in the corner. One wall is just chicken wire. Her flashlight beam stabs at the yawning darkness beneath the house. There is a public school desk chair combo. The name MARTIN neatly carved into it, then scratched out. A broken light bulb overhead, its wires running to a corner of the house. Grace cautiously unrolls the sleeping bag. A pair of socks, underwear, T-shirt neatly folded inside. She rolls it back up. Finds a large jar, picks it up. Very old feces inside, a makeshift toilet. She sets it down. Grace pulls the door shut.   And turns off her flashlight. Pitch black. So quiet. She sits there, in the musty little cage. Listening to her BREATHING, to her HEART BEAT. So lonely, so frightening. A tear rolls down her cheek. She SNIFFLES, wipes away the tear. A beat. Grace hears SCRATCHING. She clicks on her light. GRACE'S FLASHBACK - INT. MARTIN'S CELL - NIGHT YOUNG MARTIN ASHER IS HUDDLED in the corner, shivering, CRYING and WHIMPERING. Martin looks AT us with haunted eyes. INT. MARTIN'S CELL - NIGHT (PRESENT) Grace REACTS, nothing is there. Chuckles for scaring herself. Grace feels the chicken wire. MORE SCRATCHING. Grace freezes. Listening carefully. Mice? SOMETHING moves closer. (CONTINUED) 50. CONTINUED: She swings her flashlight on:       TWO FIERY EYES. WHAM! Something big slams into the chicken wire. Teeth flashing, GROWLING. It's a BADGER. Grace almost shoots it. The fearless beast GROWLS. Grace kicks the door open and runs out of there. INT. UNMARKED CAR - MOVING - NIGHT Laval driving back to Montreal.      Grace is shaken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I just shaved ten years off my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, you do feel fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Rabies scares me.     Only rabies. Nothing else. Her CELL RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanderholt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace. Someone broke into my office. Minutes ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the art gallery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   My office here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are they still there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you call the police?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me to call you if anything happened. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be right there. I'm sending a car. Don't touch anything. EXT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT Two POLICE CRUISERS SCREECH to a stop outside. INT. ART GALLERY OFFICE - NIGHT Wooden painting crates everywhere. A table saw for making frames. Costa is distressed. Grace looking at a message typed onto his computer screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do all my calls to Europe and shipping stuff at night. My address book was on the screen when I went out for coffee. I came back and this was on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long were you gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten minutes. Maybe. When I returned, that was on the screen. INSERT COMPUTER SCREEN: MR. COSTA: MEET ME TONIGHT @ LES FRERS ON RUE CHAUCER. CU @ THE BAR 1:30 A.M. Reynaud takes a picture of the screen. Laval checking the door's lock. Finds no marks. Gives Costa a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this about the strangling?   Is that guy after me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please relax, Mr. Costa. We don't know if there's a connection yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is anything missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Everything's here. (a beat) Shit. He took my organizer and my business checkbook. Grace nods for Laval to step outside with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ALLEY BEHIND GALLERY - DAY Grace and Laval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we know Costa didn't stage this? For attention or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's happy to see you. But the alarm was jumpered. Do you think Costa knows how to jumper an alarm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should take the computer. Costa who has followed them out, overheard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't take the computer.    That's my brain. Costa turns to Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not making this up.     Believe me. Grace shrugs, sees an ATM facing the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I believe you? Grace crosses to the ATM.   Peers into its security camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or should I believe this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe what you want. He's cocky, Grace likes that. EXT. ALLEY - ATM VIDEO - NIGHT Being fast forwarded. COSTA exits his office.        Locks the door. He walks TOWARD CAMERA and EXITS FRAME. A MAN'S SILHOUETTE in the alley. Crossing towards the office door. An ATM CUSTOMER blocks the shot. The ATM customer moves on. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Nobody is there.     Then: MARTIN ASHER exits Costa's office. Closes the door. APPROACHES CAMERA, nonchalant. His face is clear; the piercing eyes, the sharp features. Asher EXITS FRAME. Fast forward some more until Costa ENTERS FRAME and crosses to his office with a cup of coffee. The VIDEO STOPS. It REWINDS. FREEZES ON ASHER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that the man you saw choking Mr. Ford? Fear flashes across Costa's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must of walked right past him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Costa, is that the man you saw kill Mr. Ford in the parking lot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. That's him. That is the man I saw murder Todd Ford in the parking lot outside my gym. No doubt. Now will you go catch him, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.   I just needed you to say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this guy? He's like a Ninja. Sneaking into my office. How dangerous is he? Does he want to kill me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, no harm will come to you. Listen to me. No harm will come to you. I promise. Anyone who wants to hurt you will have to get through these two for starters. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She gestures at Laval and Reynaud.     Costa turns to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many people have you killed? Reynaud shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be safe, my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want you to be there tonight. A beat, Costa smiles.     Realizes she's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm not meeting him. Absolutely not. You ever go fishing? The bait always dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't get within fifty feet of you. The second we see him, the cuffs go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, no. INT. STAKEOUT VAN - NIGHT Costa gives Grace a look as Reynaud tapes a microphone to the BODY ARMOR he is wearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if he shoots me in the head?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will take the bullet for you like the Secret Service. Okay, friend? Reynaud is serious.     Grace helps Costa with his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're good. You could move a lot of art if you wanted to. Their eyes meet for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And inspire some too, I'm sure. Right then something very rare happens; Grace blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LES FRERS - NIGHT (1:29 AM) Ultra-hip. The dance floor THROBS with CLUBGOERS.      THE DJ THUMPS a EUROBEAT. Costa sits at the bar. PEOPLE all around him, jostling to buy drinks. Two busy BARTENDERS sling booze. Costa finds the noise and crowd absolutely nerve- wracking. He twirls the ice in his Scotch with a finger. Staring at the clock. 1:31 AM. He's nervous, sweat beads his forehead. A big BARTENDER, an undercover cop, pours Costa a Scotch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.   You're doing fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you look any more like a cop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could I have some water?    I'm cooking in this thing. Costa scratches around the neck of the hot BODY ARMOR. The Bartender gives him a Dasani. VARIOUS ANGLES: A half-dozen UNDERCOVERS are mixed in with the CLUBGOERS. CAMERA FINDS Reynaud sitting at the bar near Costa, gives Costa a reassuring nod through the crowd. INT. UNMARKED CAR - NIGHT (1:53 AM) Parked outside the club. Grace and Laval watch Costa via the TV built into the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Costa fits Asher's choice of victims. Travels the World looking for art. Single. No kids or anything. (looking around) Asher's here somewhere. Watching. With all the patience in the world. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I had his patience. He should be a cop. His mother should be punished. Like the owner of pit bulls that attack kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't keep them in a cage. INT. LES FRERS - NIGHT (2:03 AM) Costa looks miserable. Overheating, anxiously nursing his water. He looks around. Then REACTS. A note sits on the bar top. Right in front of him. Costa looks around. Only sees strange faces. Costa carefully unfolds the note.       It reads:   "MEET ME IN THE RESTROOM NOW." INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT Costa walks down a narrow hallway. Paint peeling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: TO: INT. TASK FORCE ROOM - NIGHT Costa, Grace, Laval and Reynaud. Costa stands there looking at Asher's image on the video monitor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Red light bulbs hanging from the ceiling. Approaching the men's room, Costa looks over his shoulder. No one is watching. INT. MEN'S ROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION Costa cautiously pushes open the door. Stepping inside. Dingy tiles. DRIPPING FAUCET. Several stalls. The room seems empty. Costa swallows, bends down. Checks under the stalls. Nothing. Nothing. Nothing... Then. Something. At the far stall. A pair of men's shoes. Black. Polished. Facing the stall door. Waiting... Costa freezes.     Backs away as... The stall door slowly swings open. HINGES CREAK.        A foot, a trouser cuff. A leg stepping out... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: A BLACK MAN emerges.       One of the guys at the end of the bar. Costa exhales.        A bundle of nerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go outside. Costa eyes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're calling it off. EXT. ALLEY OUTSIDE CLUB - NIGHT Costa bursts from the fire exit, fed up. He rips off the wire, he struggles out of the body armor. Grace and Laval watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a life. I can't play superhero for you. I don't handle stress very well. I have an art show to open tomorrow and I don't know what I'm putting on the walls yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you have a life. So did the people who have lost theirs. Someone else might die if you do not help us. Every time someone dies it affects forty, fifty lives. Costa looks at her, arms on his hips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, I've been cooperating. I even drew you a picture. You can't put your responsibility on me. You have a badge, not me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If somebody else dies, and you know you could have done more to stop it, you're going to feel like shit for a very long time, Mr. Costa. A beat.   That resonates with Costa. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to help you guys but I don't have time to hang out and listen to bad techno. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay to be scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scared? I'm off-the-charts terrified. There's a pissed-off serial killer after me. I mean, what did I do to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw him and that's enough. Don't stop living your life. You'll be protected by armed officers twenty-four seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until he's caught?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't promise you that. Costa is torn, Grace empathizes with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a lot of work to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A car is watching the gallery. You'll be okay. Costa looking at Grace.     He decides to trust her. INT. DIRECTOR GILLET'S OFFICE - DAY Director Gillet leans against a wall, smoking a pipe. Grace, Laval, Reynaud sit on the tired couches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who was in Asher's grave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dan Soulsby. He went missing from the Alberta Military Institute two days before the accident. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure Soulsby's death was a homicide, Asher saw the opportunity and took it. He became Soulsby and bummed around Seattle for a couple years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is Asher after Costa? Why isn't he in Mexico getting a new face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Costa saw him. Costa caught him in the act, caught him being Martin Asher. Seen first by his mother, then by Costa. For the first time he's failed at taking a life, and since we found the apartment, he can't be Edwards. To be seen, to be recognized, is a horrifying thing to Asher. He has no identity and wants it that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is the real Mr. Edwards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Likely dead and buried south of the border somewhere. (beat) South of the American border somewhere. Visa records put Asher, using Kohler's ID and Edwards at a Mexican surf resort. Edwards' last charge was sixteen hundred dollars at a 'no questions asked' facelift clinic in Guadalajara. Director Gillet taps out his pipe.     Looks at a new, more detailed portrait of Asher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you contacted the clinic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. They are also 'no questions answered.' Mr. Kohler suddenly paid off his credit card bills, thanks to money from Edwards. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep's the collection agencies off the trail. How do we flush Mr. Asher?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's focused on Costa. Who fits the profile of Asher's victims. He went on Costa's computer and E- mailed copies of Costa's files to an E-mail account in Denmark. Constant threat of discovery, Asher will become more disorganized. Laval and Reynaud agree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. My office will arrange a press conference. I will tell a room full of correspondents we have a suspect who is dead and murder victims who are alive. And I'll sound like a madman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does sound crazy. That's what the press likes, sir. INT. POLICE BUILDING LOBBY - NEWS VIDEO - DAY Director Gillet stands tall before a podium. Blinded by lights. A bouquet of microphones in his face. Beside him is a haunting poster-sized portrait of Martin Asher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Asher, we know who you really are. We will find you and we will arrest you. You can hide no longer. EXT. ART GALLERY - DAY Posters advertise SUMMERFEST.     CITY WORKERS put up barricades and porto-potties. INT. ART GALLERY - DAY Two CARPENTERS uncrate and hang paintings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON COSTA Lost in thought. He studies a series of vivid paintings leaning against the wall. He crosses. Changes the order. Steps back. Something isn't right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Costa, some men in that car have been watching this place all morning. The Carpenters looking out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're protecting the art. Go ahead and hang those. Be very careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir. Costa hears a POLICE RADIO. Spins around. Grace and Reynaud have entered. Costa is apprehensive. What now? Grace gives him a reassuring smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Security is going to be very solid tonight. She waves him out of earshot of the Carpenters.     Their faces are close. Grace gets butterflies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he going to show up tonight? What do I do, offer him a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't show. But we want to be here in case he does. Four plainclothes officers will form a perimeter watching the four corners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A perimeter, excellent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. And four plainclothes officers will be in here. Mingling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mingling? I don't need four bruisers crashing through my clientele. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officers will be very discreet. We won't interfere with your thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With my thing.    Will you be mingling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.     If you feel safer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much safer. EXT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT Summerfest, a street festival, is just warming up.       It could be Mardi Gras, plastic cups and glowsticks. INT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT (9:39 PM) A cutting edge club feel. A DJ spins a captivating mellow mix. The gallery is filled PATRONS ABUZZ with chit-chat. Inspector Laval and Reynaud study the patrons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This painting costs more than my house. Reynaud shakes his head. FIND GRACE She's stunning and shy about it. She examines a painting. A gentle hand touches her back. She turns. It's Costa. He hands her a highball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look a little anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all you. Grace gives Costa a look.       She sips her drink, nods at the painting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to get into the show, but I mean. What is this? It looks like somebody napalmed the Garden of Eden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mangos.   Ripe mangos hanging on a branch. Now she sees it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Okay. Why the borders? Almost every painting has one. Was he in prison or something? Costa REACTS, impressed by Grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most people don't notice. This is from his prison series. He could see a mango grove through his cell window. He made some of the pigments himself. From flowers. From his own blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was his crime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He attacked his neighbor with a machete. There was a woman involved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always is. Grace sips her drink, letting herself relax.       She enjoys Costa's company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had a lot of lovers, didn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dozens. He was a consumer of life's pleasures. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now he's dead and you get rich?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His children formed a corporation, I take ten percent. I'm not a buccaneer, Grace. Grace looks at Costa and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I've ever met anyone quite like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're very sensitive for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An FBI agent? The ELEGANT WOMAN spots Costa and crosses. She lays a hand on Costa's shoulder. He turns and they kiss cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, it's amazing tonight. I want to cry, I'm so touched. Grace watches her hand linger on Costa's arm. And is amazed that she feels jealous. She catches Costa's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Costa, I would like to discuss an arrangement for the series. The Elegant Woman REACTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a sec, John. She crosses to the Older Man in b.g.       Costa is miffed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not writing the checks. The Elegant Woman returns with the Older Man.       He grabs Costa's hand. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, it's incredible what you've put together. (aside to Costa) The thing we were talking about the other day, well I'd like to proceed. Hell, I'm sick of making two percent in the market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dick, they're yours. The Older Man smiles, shakes Costa's hand. The Elegant Woman looking at Grace, arms crossed, enjoys her victory. Grace plays along, stalks off, hiding a grin. INT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT A few minutes later Costa finds Grace at the turntables looking through the DJ's records.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you miss wax?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You helped me close the biggest sale of the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's my cut?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Grace smiles coyly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Costa looks at Grace for a long beat.      Not sure what her game is, or if he wants to play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me know when you do.   Excuse me. Costa walks away.     Grace REACTS; she didn't want that. INT. ART GALLERY - BATHROOM - NIGHT Costa takes a leak.     He's in a good mood. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The window above the stalls is open. The noise of the PARTYING CROWD on the sidewalks outside. Costa finishes, washes his hands.        Pauses.    Smoothes his hair. SOMEONE BEHIND HIM Costa looks in the mirror and REACTS. MARTIN ASHER stares at him from the mirror. No doubt who it is. Asher is wound tight, not at all happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put your hands on the wall. Asher jams a gun in Costa's back.        Costa is very scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please be cool with that.    I don't wanna get hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should blow your spine out. My face is everywhere. I have to hide in the shadows like a fucking animal because of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir. I apologize for everything you think I may have done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're moved past sorry. You ruined everything. John, soon to be dead, Costa. Asher's eyes flash. WHAM! Asher slams Costa's face into the mirror. Costa's nose bleeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! INT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT Reynaud stands near the bathroom. He heard that.          He approaches the door, tests the knob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ART GALLERY - BATHROOM - NIGHT The door opens. Costa hits the deck. Asher spins, aims at Reynaud and FIRES. POP-POP-POP-POP! Reynaud drops and rolls out of the line of fire. INT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT Asher bursts from the bathroom, running right over Reynaud, who draws his pistol. Grace pulls a pistol, Laval too. Asher running through the patrons. Grace takes a knee and aims. She doesn't have a clear shot. Asher aims his gun straight ahead as he runs. People hit the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of my way! POP! Asher SHOOTS a WINDOW, SHATTERING it. He shoulders his way through the safety glass. Grace and Laval follow. EXT. ART GALLERY - NIGHT Chaos. Summerfest is in full swing. A swirling, boiling CROWD of shiny faces. Asher dives into their midst. Grace plunges in after him. Inspector Laval follows. INT. ART GALLERY - BATHROOM - NIGHT Costa is stunned, Reynaud checks him for bullet holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay. From Reynaud's radio:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (filtered, subtitled French) Jean, he ran into the damn crowd. Reynaud bolts out of there. EXT. FESTIVAL STREET - NIGHT Asher and his pursuers leave a wake of disturbed REVELERS that Reynaud follows. Asher running. Careening, rolling, bouncing off PEOPLE. He has the tireless power of a soccer player.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON GRACE Running.   Equally tireless.      Locked onto Asher like a missile. Grace is slowly gaining on Asher. Laval behind her.      Running.   Screaming in his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (subtitled French) We're heading East. Form a line at Seychelles. A dozen UNIFORMS charge through the crowd. EXT. INTERSECTION - DAY Police RADIOS busy with CHATTER. UNIFORMS clear a path for two PATROL CARS. SIRENS WHOOP as they coast in, TAP bumpers, blocking the intersection. POLICE OFFICERS form a formidable skirmish line. SHOUTING for REVELERS to move aside. EXT. FESTIVAL STREET - NIGHT Asher running. Gun in his pocket. Elbowing his way through the crowd. Asher REACTS. He sees the gauntlet of UNIFORMS and PATROL CARS blocking the intersection ahead. Asher shoves his hand in his pocket... BOOM!   BOOM-BOOM!     POP-POP-POP! Thunderous GUNFIRE. Grace hits the deck. The Uniforms hit the deck. The CROWD SCREAMS, CLAPS and WHISTLES. direction.raw_text: You become her. I become him.    We are married, see? Asher slides a woman's wedding ring across the table. Already inscribed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have the babies. We raise them. However you want. I just want to be with you. Grace looking at Asher, not sure whether to laugh out loud or start crying. He seems edgy; he needs her decision quick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happens if I don't want to assume this woman's identity and raise my babies with a serial killer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace, don't be morbid. If anyone can deal with this, you can. I know you felt what I felt. It's real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Answer my question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll shoot you in the head and burn this place down. Grace reacts. She can respect that. Grace looking at Asher. He's scary, feeding off some fantasy about her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll do what you have to do. I can respect that. How do you know it's still real? Maybe it's gone. What we felt. Grace tilts her lips, looking in his eyes. Asher leans over to kiss her. Slow, delicate. Asher kneels beside her, the kisses become hungry, desperate. Grace's eyes are so open, so vulnerable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I missed you so much. Asher leans in to kiss her... Grace head-butts him.    CRUNCH!   Smashes his nose. She drives her feet down and her shoulder into his chest. Asher, already on his knees, falls back. Grace scrambles over him, gets out of the chair.       She shoulders over the kitchen table... There is a holster mounted underneath the table. Grace turns her back so she can grab the gun from it. Grace REACTS.     There is no gun in the holster. Asher looking at her, matter of fact:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I searched everything. Asher stands, reaches for the Glock on the counter. Grace can't let him get it. She lunges at Asher, collides into his knees, hurting him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn you! Asher grabs a large knife from the butcher's block. THWACK!   Plunges it into Grace's belly. Grace GASPS, looking at the knife embedded in her stomach. A beat as Grace and Asher stare at the knife. Grace uses the pause to kick away from Asher.       She gets on her feet and runs from the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. OLD FARMHOUSE - NIGHT Grace exits the kitchen door, running with her hands cuffed behind her. Running for her life. She runs for the nearby woods. Her shoes CRUNCHING through a layer of fresh ice over old snow. Fighting for balance. POP-POP-POP! Asher OPENS FIRE on her from the house. BULLETS HIT the ice around her. Grace runs into the woods.   Branches sheathed in ice. Smacking her face. Asher exits the house, FIRING -- POP-POP-POP-POP! BULLETS EXPLODE the ice around Grace. She dives to the ground. She takes the opportunity to move her handcuffs from behind to in front. She unties and removes the heavy prosthetic belly she wears. Grace is not pregnant. She pulls the knife out. Grace runs deeper into the woods. Asher running in the woods behind her. The gun in his hand at the ready. Asher is hunting. He intends to kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep fucking running, Grace, you're only going to die tired! ON GRACE Running. Batting away ice-covered branches.     Drenched with sleet. Hypothermic conditions. EXT. OLD PRIVATE ROAD - NIGHT Grace emerges from the woods. Running along the icy road. She slips and falls. Cuts her hand on the ice. Grace stands, and keeps running, her hand bleeding, the knife getting slippery. ON ASHER Gaining on her. Grace slips again, scrabbling on the ice, trying to keep moving. A slow motion nightmare. Here comes Asher.   No mercy.   He aims the gun at her face... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction
